entry.title: Re: SAP B1 Service Layer ‚Äì Order creation fails with ‚ÄúBad...
entry.content:
I have finally found the issue and maybe the solution helps someone else.

Root cause: Extra cookie attributes (e.g., path=/; Secure;) were included in the Cookie header that was sent back to the SAP Service Layer, and Expect: 100-continue was sent by cURL. These were treated by some Service Layer setups as malformed request metadata, and a 400 ‚ÄúBad Post content‚Äù was returned.

What was changed:

  • Only the cookie values from the login response (B1SESSION and optional ROUTEID) were parsed, and a clean Cookie header was rebuilt:
    Cookie: B1SESSION=<‚Ä¶>; ROUTEID=<‚Ä¶> (with no path, Secure, etc.).
  • The 100-continue handshake was disabled by sending an empty Expect: header.
  • Explicit JSON headers (Content-Type / Accept) were applied on the login and subsequent requests.

Result: The POST body was accepted, the request was no longer rejected by the Service Layer, and the orders were created successfully.

entry.title: Re: Enhancing the Standard XML File for Electronic Documents using the BAdI EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD
entry.content:
Hello Joanem,

It‚Äôs not possible to add additional tags to the existing XML, as the XML structure is generated from the proxy. If the proxy structures are delivered from SAP, they cannot be modified.

It‚Äôs possible that the XML field you are looking for already exists but is not currently displayed, since XML only shows tags when they contain values. I would suggest checking the respective proxy structure for that country to see if the field is available and can be populated.

If the field does not exist in the proxy at all, then unfortunately it cannot be added.

You can find this preview on the current SAP Help Portal page SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (see What‚Äôs New section ‚ÄúPreview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.2‚Äù). To access the Preliminary What‚Äôs New information, please use the What‚Äôs New Viewer or the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool.

The RASD tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What‚Äôs New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The preliminary information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.2 will be available in RASD within the next few days. We recommend using RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you. For any feedback you may have, try the Commenting Feature for What's New documentation in this release. See this blog for more information.

entry.title: HR Efficiency in Action: Automate and Streamline HR Processes
entry.content:
HR teams today are under more pressure than ever. They must support global workforces, ensure compliance, respond to business change, and still deliver a great employee experience. Yet, many HR processes remain manual, repetitive, or fragmented, slowing down operations and leaving little time for strategic work.

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central offers practical, high-impact tools to simplify processes, automate routine tasks, and empower employees and managers to take more control. Best of all, many of these capabilities can be enabled quickly without major transformation projects, giving you ‚ÄòQuick Wins‚Äô!  This blog explores a practical framework for scaling HR efficiency.

Simplify, Automate, Empower: The HR Efficiency Framework

The path to a more efficient HR function can be broken into three focus areas:

1. Simplification

Simplification means reducing manual steps and making processes more intuitive for both HR and managers. It‚Äôs about removing friction, standardizing where possible, and giving HR teams tools that are easier to use.

Key examples include:

  • Configurable Hire Templates: Hiring should adapt to different needs, not force a one-size-fits-all process. With configurable templates, HR can tailor data collection by country, employment type, or business unit. For example, you may not need bank details for contingent workers, or dependent data in certain countries. Templates ensure only relevant data is captured, reducing errors and saving time. They also support custom fields and objects, so unique organizational needs can be addressed without customization.
  • Mass Data Changes: HR teams often need to update records for hundreds of employees at once; for reorgs, policy updates, contract changes., etc.  SuccessFactors offers multiple tools to manage bulk updates:
    • Mass Data Management: A user-friendly interface to filter, preview, and update positions or employee job information in bulk; without Excel files.
    • Manage Mass Changes: Ideal for more complex updates to employee Job Information or Job Relationships, using groups and batch jobs.
    • Manage Mass Changes for Metadata Objects: Uses business rules to apply logic-driven updates to Positions and other objects ‚Äì for example., changing departments based on grade and location.
    • Integration Center: Build and schedule automated data flows between SuccessFactors and other systems.
    • Data Imports: The tried-and-true method using templates to load and/or update employee or foundation data.

Together, these tools give HR flexibility to match the method to the scenario; from quick fixes to large-scale changes.

  • Add New Employee to This Position: A small but powerful feature, this allows hiring to start directly from an open position in the Position Org Chart. Relevant details from the position (like company, location, or cost center) flow into the new hire record, cutting re-entry and reducing errors.
  • Custom Home Page Cards: Employees don‚Äôt usually log in daily, so making key information visible matters. Custom cards let HR share reminders, campaigns, or quick links directly on the homepage. They‚Äôre easy to configure and a great way to keep employees engaged with minimal effort.

2. Automation

Where simplification removes steps, automation removes work altogether. Automating repetitive processes not only saves time but also improves consistency and compliance.

Practical examples include:

  • Automatic Hire: Once candidate data is captured in Recruiting or Onboarding, SuccessFactors can move it directly into Employee Central without manual intervention. HR can set rules so only complete or validated candidates are processed automatically, while exceptions still route to Manage Pending Hires. This reduces admin overhead and speeds up onboarding.
  • Effective Workflow Processing: Approvals are critical for governance but can easily become bottlenecks. SuccessFactors workflows now offer:
    • Auto-delegation groups: Managers can delegate different workflows to different people (e.g., time approvals to an admin, pay changes to a senior manager).
    • Workflow Professional Edition: HR can reassign, resend, or mass approve workflows without IT help.
    • Microsoft Teams Integration: Approvals can be completed directly in Teams, speeding up decision-making and reducing HR follow-up.
  • Document Generation: Employment letters, verification statements, and other documents can be generated in bulk or on demand; by employees, managers, or HR. Instead of waiting on HR services, employees can self-serve common requests like proof of employment. Managers can generate promotion or probation letters instantly. HR can bulk-generate bonus or termination letters. This reduces admin workload and provides faster service to employees.   

 

3. Empowerment

The third lever of HR efficiency is empowerment: giving employees and managers the tools to self-serve, find answers, and act without relying on HR every time.

Examples include:

  • Joule AI: The conversational AI copilot embedded in SuccessFactors. Joule can:
    • Complete tasks like changing addresses or approving workflows (transactional support).
    • Guide users to the right page (navigational help).
    • Answer questions about HR policies or leave balances (informational help).

Available on desktop and mobile, Joule reduces HR service desk tickets and improves the employee experience by providing instant, accurate help.

  • Document Grounding: Joule‚Äôs answers are backed by your organization‚Äôs own policy documents. For example, if an employee asks about parental leave, Joule will reference your own HR policy, provide a summary, and link to the source. This builds trust and ensures answers are accurate.

 

Why This Matters

The case for HR efficiency isn‚Äôt just about saving time. It‚Äôs about enabling HR to do its real job: building people strategies that drive business success.  Many organizations are underusing automation and AI. This leads to inefficiencies, errors, and limited scalability, particularly for global organizations.

By embracing quick wins like configurable templates, bulk updates, streamlined workflows, and AI-powered self-service, HR can free up hours of manual work each week, improve data quality, and deliver a smoother experience for employees.

For more information, examples of quick wins, please view our recent Webinar, including recording, slides: 

Webinar: HR Efficiency in Action - Recording and Slides

entry.title: Re: How to call a API in BADI implementation in HANA Clou...
entry.content:
Hello @Ravi_Solanki 

Here is a  recommendation for SAP S/4HANA public cloud to read the supplier confirmation data in the implemented BADI while workflow triggers

Preferably, read in-tenant data directly

Within the workflow BAdI (Business Add-In), read confirmations via the released CDS (Core Data Services) view I_POSupplierConfirmationAPI01. This approach provides a quick, upgrade-safe, and ABAP Cloud-compliant solution.

Minimal pattern:
SELECT SupplierConfirmation, PurchaseOrder, PurchaseOrderItem,
ConfirmationCategory, ConfirmedQuantity, ConfirmedDeliveryDate
FROM I_POSupplierConfirmationAPI01
WHERE PurchaseOrder = @lv_po AND PurchaseOrderItem = @lv_item
INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_conf).
Use lt_conf to drive your agent determination or condition logic.

Only if cross-tenant or external data is required.
Call the OData (Open Data Protocol) V4 Supplier Confirmation API through a configured destination (avoid direct URL calls). This utilises the ABAP Cloud HTTP client and preserves the workflow step's responsiveness.

Confirm the next step:

Which workflow hook are we in: agent determination or start/step condition?

The exact fields you want to evaluate, like confirmation category, confirmed quantity, and confirmed delivery date.

Expected volumes, so we can add simple guards such as timeouts and result limits to maintain stable workflow performance.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.content:
Hi everybody, the first week of Devtoberfest is over and we are heading strong into Week 2. This blog post should give you a good overview on what is happening in our second week of Devtoberfest.

Sessions for Week 2 (Oct 6 - Oct 10):

All sessions for Week 2 can be found in our Session Catalogue: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events

In week 2, we are launching the new and challenging SAP Puzzles! Head over to the Tutorial Navigator to solve the puzzles and earn points.

entry.title: Re: 'Build Your First App with CAP' bookshop tutorial : D...
entry.content:
Hi Jens,

the bookstore repo is not setup for deployment using workzone, but you can add a few files to make it work.

app/<app>/ui5-deploy.yaml

Example with admin-authors:

# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://sap.github.io/ui5-tooling/schema/ui5.yaml.json
specVersion: '3.1'
metadata:
  name: admin-authors
type: application
resources:
  configuration:
    propertiesFileSourceEncoding: UTF-8
builder:
  resources:
    excludes:
      - "/test/**"
      - "/localService/**"
  customTasks:
    - name: ui5-task-zipper
      afterTask: generateVersionInfo
      configuration:
        archiveName: admin-authors
        additionalFiles:
          - xs-app.json

app/<app>/package.json

Example with admin-authors:

{
    "name": "admin-authors",
    "version": "0.0.1",
    "description": "A Fiori application.",
    "keywords": [
        "ui5",
        "openui5",
        "sapui5"
    ],
    "main": "webapp/index.html",
    "scripts": {
        "deploy-config": "npx -p @SAP/ux-ui5-tooling fiori add deploy-config cf",
        "build": "ui5 build preload --clean-dest --config ui5-deploy.yaml",
        "build-local": "ui5 build preload --clean-dest",
        "start": "ui5 serve"
    },
    "devDependencies": {
        "@ui5/cli": "^4",
        "ui5-task-zipper": "^3"
    },
    "ui5": {
        "dependencies": [
            "ui5-task-zipper"
        ]
    }
}

The background is that the html5 apps repository expects a zip file for the upload, which is typically built using the ui5-task-zipper during the ui5 build. You can also check these configurations in the incidents sample app.

entry.title: New CI Pipeline Restart Extension features: supporting new Pipeline package and improved Restart Job
entry.content:
We are excited to announce the release of Cloud Integration Pipeline Extension - Restart via Data Store in version 1.0.1.

This update introduces several powerful new features and improvements:

  • Supports new integration packages for the Pipeline for Cloud Integration and allows flexible linkage of Generic Pipeline copies to the Pipeline Stages.
  • Enhanced Restart Job Integration Flow:
    • Generic Job Profile to restart all integration scenarios defined in the Partner Directory through the Pipeline Framework.
    • New configuration options to persist the Job Log.
    • New Integration Flow "Pipeline API - Restart Job Log" to retrieve both the Restart Job run list and detailed log data (if log persistence is enabled).
  • Improved configuration and monitoring: New parameters (such as "NotOlderThanHours" for Restart Job), several bug fixes, enriched monitoring headers, and better exception handling.

With these enhancements, version 1.0.1 delivers more flexibility, transparency, and control when managing restarts in your Cloud Integration pipelines.

Integration Package content

New package consists of six Integration Flows, one central Script Collection and one Value Mapping. 2 new artifacts have been added:

  • Pipeline API ‚Äì Restart Job Log (Optional). This Integration Flow enables API-based retrieval of stored Job Logs. It is built on top of the standard Message Processing Logs (MPL) API and allows either to retrieve the restart job log or to query MPL details of executed Restart Jobs.
  • Value Mapping to determine Pipeline Stage (Optional). The Data Store Entry Name includes a 2-letter code for the Pipeline Stage, derived from the technical name of Pipeline IFlow where the error occurred. This Value Mapping allows to link custom IFlow copies to their Pipeline Stage.

Support for new Pipeline integration packages

The new Cloud Integration Pipeline packages introduce Integration Flows with updated technical IDs that include the version marker ‚Äúv2‚Äù. To ensure compatibility, these new IFlow IDs have been added to the stage determination logic.

In addition, the latest Pipeline version now propagates the MPL ID of the source Pipeline IFlow to the custom error handling IFlow. This allows the Data Store entry name to be built using the original source MPL ID, rather than the MPL ID of the custom error handling flow (as was the case in version 1 of the Cloud Integration Pipeline package).

Pipeline Stage Determination

Each Data Store entry name includes the mandatory attribute Pipeline Stage, which indicates where the exception occurred. In the new version of the Restart Extension, the pipeline stage is resolved through a two-step process. If neither step succeeds, a default value is assigned: Stage (NA) or "Not Assigned".

  1. Technical ID Prefix Check. The system first evaluates the prefix of the source pipeline Integration Flow‚Äôs technical ID. This was the only approach available in version 1.0.0. For example, if you copy a generic Integration Flow to create a receiver-specific outbound pipeline IFlow, the technical ID must start with the correct stage prefix:
    com.sap.integration.cloud.pipeline.v2.generic.step06.outbound.myCustomIFlow is resolved to stage (OB).
  2. Value Mapping Check. If the stage cannot be determined from the prefix, the new version applies a Value Mapping. This mapping links custom IFlow technical IDs to specific pipeline stages, allowing you to flexibly assign non-standard technical IDs to the correct stage (see screenshot).

Generic (Default) Job Profile

In version 1.0.0, the Restart Job IFlow could restart only specific interfaces defined in the Job Profile. One of the most common feedback points was the need for a generic Restart Job, similar to what is available in SAP PO, that could restart all integration scenarios configured for the Cloud Integration Pipeline.

This capability has now been added. With the Generic Restart Job Profile, all scenarios where the Partner ID is determined using the Alternative Partner approach can be restarted in one go. The configuration effort is minimal: the only requirement is that the Job Profile status is set to "active."

Optionally, you can exclude specific integration scenarios from the Generic Restart Job by providing them in the parameter InterfacePidExclusionList.

New Job Profile Parameters

The Restart Job Profile now supports additional optional parameters that extend flexibility and monitoring:

  • NotOlderThanHours. In version 1.0.0, filtering was only possible with the static interval parameters TimeFrom and TimeTo. In the new version, if TimeFrom is not explicitly set, this parameter can dynamically calculate it as: 
TimeFrom = (Job run start timestamp) ‚Äì (Configured number of hours in NotOlderThanHours)
  • RestartJobLog. By default, the job log is stored only in memory within the message header jobLogHeader (accessible only when Trace is activated). With this parameter, you can define where and how the job log is stored:
    • attach ‚Äì the job log is attached to the MPL of the Restart Job IFlow, using the Restart Job ID as MPL Attachment name.
    • persist ‚Äì the job log is persisted in the database using the Persist Message step.
    • custom ‚Äì the job log is sent via a ProcessDirect extension to a custom-built IFlow. In this case, an additional parameter must be maintained in the Job Profile restartJobLogExitEndpoint with the value of ProcessDirect endpoint.

Pipeline API Operations

A new API Integration Flow Pipeline API ‚Äì Restart Job Log has been introduced in the latest package version. This Integration Flow enables API-based retrieval of Restart Job Logs, provided that the RestartJobLog parameter of the Job Profile is set to either "attach" or "persist".

The following queries are supported:

  • Retrieve the restart job log for a specific Restart Job instance by supplying either the MPL ID of the Restart Job IFlow or the unique Restart Job ID.
  • Query MPL details of executed Restart Jobs based on selection criteria, in order to obtain the MPL ID of the Restart Job IFlow or the unique Restart Job ID.

For further details, see the updated Configuration Guide included in the package.

entry.title: Transforming Healthcare Procurement: Lessons from Our S/4HANA MM Implementation
entry.content:
Introduction

When our healthcare organization decided to migrate from SAP ECC to S/4HANA, the procurement team faced a critical challenge: how do we transform decades-old processes while ensuring uninterrupted supply of life-saving medical supplies? As the SAP MM consultant leading this implementation, I learned valuable lessons that could benefit others embarking on similar journeys.

The Challenge

Healthcare procurement is uniquely complex. Unlike typical manufacturing or retail, we had to contend with:

  • Regulatory compliance: Medical devices and pharmaceuticals require strict traceability
  • Just-in-time criticality: Stock-outs can literally cost lives
  • Complex approval chains: Clinical, financial, and safety approvals needed for different item categories
  • Integration with IS-H: Patient care systems must seamlessly communicate with procurement

Our legacy ECC system had grown organically over 15 years, with customizations layered upon customizations. The procurement cycle averaged 14 days, with 30% of requisitions requiring manual intervention.

Our Approach: Innovation Within S/4HANA

Rather than simply replicating old processes in new technology, we took a transformation approach:

1. Simplified Material Master Data

We reduced material master variants from 12 to 4 by leveraging S/4HANA's Universal Journal. This alone cut data maintenance time by 60%.

Key Innovation: We created a custom Fiori app for clinical staff to request new materials with built-in compliance checks. This reduced incorrect material master requests by 75%.

2. Automated Approval Workflows

Using SAP Workflow and business rules, we automated 70% of approvals:

  • Low-value items (<¬£500): Auto-approved based on budget holder rules
  • Standard medical supplies: Single-click approval via mobile Fiori
  • High-value/controlled substances: Multi-level workflow with audit trail

Technical Detail: We integrated S/4HANA MM with our IS-H patient safety system, automatically flagging any procurement that could impact patient protocols.

3. Intelligent Inventory Optimization

We implemented SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) alongside MM to predict demand based on:

  • Historical patient admission patterns
  • Seasonal variations (flu season, holiday periods)
  • Planned surgical schedules from IS-H

This reduced emergency orders by 45% while cutting inventory holding costs by ¬£380,000 annually.

4. Supplier Collaboration Portal

Built on SAP Ariba integration, we gave suppliers real-time visibility into:

  • Forecast demand
  • Purchase order status
  • Invoice status and payment schedules

Result: Order-to-delivery time dropped from 8 days to 3 days average.

Implementation Challenges & Solutions

Challenge 1: Change Management with Clinical Staff

Problem: Clinicians are notoriously resistant to new systems that take time away from patient care.

Solution:

  • Created role-specific Fiori launchpads (different for doctors, nurses, department managers)
  • Built "emergency override" function for genuine urgent needs
  • Gamified adoption with department leaderboards showing fastest approval times

Result: 94% user adoption within 3 months (vs. industry average of 65-70%).

Challenge 2: IS-H Integration Complexity

Problem: Our patient management system (IS-H) needed real-time inventory data, but standard integration was causing performance issues.

Solution:

  • Implemented SAP CPI (Cloud Platform Integration) for asynchronous data exchange
  • Created custom BAPI for critical real-time queries (e.g., "Is life-saving drug X in stock?")
  • Built caching layer for frequently accessed data

Technical Note: This architecture pattern is now being replicated across our other S/4HANA modules.

Challenge 3: Regulatory Reporting

Problem: Healthcare regulators require specific procurement reports that don't exist in standard S/4HANA.

Solution:

  • Leveraged SAP Analytics Cloud with custom CDS views
  • Created automated monthly reports pushed to regulatory portal
  • Built audit trail dashboard for compliance team

Measurable Results

After 12 months of go-live:

  • Procurement cycle time: 14 days ‚Üí 4 days (71% reduction)
  • Cost savings: ¬£380,000 annually in inventory optimization
  • Emergency orders: Reduced by 45%
  • User satisfaction: 8.7/10 (vs. 4.2/10 with old system)
  • Compliance audit findings: Zero critical issues (previously averaged 3-4 per year)
  • Supplier relationships: Net Promoter Score increased from 42 to 78

Key Takeaways for Your S/4HANA Healthcare Journey

1. Don't Just "Lift and Shift"

The power of S/4HANA is in process transformation. Challenge every legacy process before migrating it.

2. Invest Heavily in User Experience

Healthcare professionals are time-poor. If your system adds clicks, they'll find workarounds. Fiori customization was our best ROI investment.

3. Integration Architecture is Critical

Healthcare has more interconnected systems than most industries. Plan your integration strategy before configuration.

4. Build for Compliance from Day One

Retrofitting audit trails and regulatory reports is painful. Include compliance experts in your core team.

5. Phased Approach Works Better Than Big Bang

We went live in three phases:

  • Phase 1: Non-critical supplies (office, housekeeping)
  • Phase 2: Standard medical supplies
  • Phase 3: Controlled substances and high-value equipment

This allowed us to learn and adjust before risking patient care.

What's Next?

We're now exploring:

  • AI-powered demand forecasting: Using SAP AI Business Services to predict supply needs based on patient admission ML models
  • Blockchain for pharmaceutical traceability: Piloting SAP's blockchain solution for controlled substance tracking
  • Predictive maintenance: Integrating medical equipment maintenance schedules with spare parts procuremen

    Questions for the Community

    I'd love to hear from others working on healthcare S/4HANA implementations:

    1. How have you approached IS-H integration in your projects?
    2. What mobile solutions have you found most effective for clinical users?
    3. Have you implemented any AI/ML solutions for procurement optimization?

    Conclusion

    S/4HANA migration in healthcare is complex, but with the right approach, it can transform procurement from a bottleneck into a competitive advantage. The key is balancing innovation with the non-negotiable requirement of patient safety.

    If you're planning a similar implementation, feel free to reach out. I'm always happy to share lessons learned and learn from others' experiences.

  •

entry.title: What's New in SAP Analytics Cloud Modeling Extensions & Integration QRC4 2025 Release
entry.content:
Purpose

Hello SAP Community Colleagues,

I am delighted to share some fantastic new Data Integration & Conversion features made available inside the modeling area of SAP Analytics Cloud, within Business Data Cloud!

Overview

Here is a short overview of each feature:

1. Data Export API ‚Äì Master Data Hierarchies

The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of master data parent-child and level-based hierarchies. 

2. Data Export API ‚Äì Seamless Planning Support for Public Dimensions

The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of master data from public dimensions that reside in a Datasphere workspace.

3. Data Export API ‚Äì Seamless Planning Support for Fact Data Delta

The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of fact data delta changes from a SAP Analytics Cloud standard model that resides in a Datasphere space.

4. Dimension Unit Property Enhancement

In Unit Conversion, a dimension containing a unit property now displays a member selector dialog consisting of a list of Unit Symbols & Unit Descriptions that are contained in the Standard Unit & Unit Description tables.

5. New Member Selector dialog in Modeling

A new member selector dialog has been introduced into the Modeling area of SAC, replacing the previous member selection dialog.

 

Let‚Äôs now investigate each topic in further detail:

1. Data Export API ‚Äì Master Data Hierarchies

The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of Master Data Level-Based & Parent-Child Hierarchies that are part of a standard model residing in SAP Analytics Cloud.  This includes master data stored in public or private dimensions.

The export of Master Data Hierarchies is also supported for standard models that are saved on a Datasphere space.

Level-Based Hierarchies

To allow the export of Level-Based hierarchies, a new endpoint has been created called

{BaseURL}/providers/{namespaceID}/{providerID}/{DimensionName}Master 

Note: Make sure to replace {namespaceID} and {providerID} with the correct IDs and to replace {DimensionName} with the name of your dimension.

Parent-Child Hierarchies

To allow the export of Parent-Child hierarchies, a new endpoint has been created called

{BaseURL}/providers/{namespaceID}/{providerID}/{DimensionName}MasterWithHierarchy

Note: Make sure to replace {namespaceID} and {providerID} with the correct IDs and to replace {DimensionName} with the name of your dimension.

For each Parent-Child hierarchy of the dimension, each row will have 3 additional columns compared to when using the {DimensionName}Master endpoint.

These 3 columns are: 

  • {HierarchyName}_PARENTID - the id of the parent node in the hierarchy. 
  • {HierarchyName}_PREVID - the previous node which shares the same parent as this one in the hierarchy. 
  • {HierarchyName}_ORDERID - the index of this node in the list of nodes that share the parent node. 

Master Data Hierarchy export jobs can be executed using 2-legged (machine to machine) or 3-legged (Authorized User) access.  

2. Data Export API ‚Äì Seamless Planning Support for Public Dimensions

The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of Master Data from Public Dimensions that reside in a Datasphere workspace using the existing PublicDimensionData endpoint.

{BaseURL}/providers/{namespaceID}/{providerID}/PublicDimensionData

Note: Make sure to replace {namespaceID} and {providerID} with the correct IDs. 

Figure 1: Sample export of Public Dimension Data on a Datasphere space using the PublicDimensionData Endpoint

Public Dimension export jobs can be executed using 2-legged (machine to machine) or 3-legged (Authorized User) access. 

Authentication checks are in place, for 3-legged accounts, to ensure that access to the Datasphere space is permitted.

Figure 2: Authorization Check Prevents Export from a Datasphere Space.

This brings feature parity between the export of SAC public dimensions and those saved on a Datasphere space.

3. Data Export API ‚Äì Seamless Planning Support for Fact Data Delta

The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of Fact Data Delta changes from a SAP Analytics Cloud standard model that resides in a Datasphere space.  This includes support for Delta Difference & Delta Aggregation.

The API Subscriptions tab in the modeler has been enabled to allow for the delta extraction of models residing in a Datasphere space.

Figure 3: API Subscriptions Dialog Visible for SAC Models residing in a Datasphere Space

The existing Fact Data API endpoint names will also now work within this landscape using 2-legged and 3-legged authentications.

/providers/{NamespaceID}/{ProviderID}/FactData

/providers/{NamespaceID}/{ProviderID}/FactDataAggregation

This brings feature parity between the delta extraction on SAC models and models saved on a Datasphere space.

See my previous blogs covering Fact Data Difference & Fact Data Aggregation.

What‚Äôs New in SAP Analytics Cloud Modeling Extensions & Integration QRC3 2024 Release

What's New in SAP Analytics Cloud Modeling Extensions & Integration QRC3 2025 Release

4. Dimension Unit Property Enhancement

In Unit Conversion, a dimension containing a unit property now displays a member selector dialog consisting of a list of Unit Symbols & Unit Descriptions that are contained in the Standard Unit & Unit Description tables.

Previously, modelers had to navigate to the Standard Unit table, to locate the correct Unit ID and Unit Symbol and then switch to a dimension to enter the correct unit.  The member selector dialog  on unit properties of a dimension, in the grid view, reduces the risk of data-entry errors.

Figure 4: Value Help on Dimension Unit Property

5. New Member Selector dialog in Modeling

A new member selector dialog has been introduced into the Modeling area of SAC, replacing the previous member selection dialog. 

This improved flexible dialog provides an item ID and item description in the display.

Figure 5: New Member Selector in Modeling

The new dialog can be found in the following areas:

  • Generic dimensions > Data Access Control, Hierarchies, Unit Property
  • Account dimensions > Data Locking Ownership, Responsible column
  • Data Management > API Subscription filters
  • Calculation Workspace > Grid view ‚Äì Exception aggregation / Required dimensions, preview panel filters
  • Formula Editor > Dynamic time dimension
  • Model Structure > delete facts
  • Variables

6. More new Modeling Features...

Some additional new and exciting features in the Modeling area of SAP Analytics Cloud coming in QRC4 2025 include:

  • Consuming a Datasphere view as an external version into an SAC Planning Model.
  • Consuming Google Big Query as an external version into an SAC Planning Model.
  • Introduction of Clean and Replace Subset of Data option into the Data Upload Starter.

Conclusion

In summary, the following new features and updates have been introduced to the Modeling Extensions and Integration areas of SAP Analytics Cloud, within Business Data Cloud, as part of QRC4 2025 release.

1. The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of master data parent-child and level-based hierarchies. 

2. The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of master data from public dimensions that reside in a Datasphere space.

3. The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of fact data delta changes from an SAP Analytics Cloud standard model that resides in a Datasphere space.

4. Dimension properties of type Unit now offer a member selector dialog containing a list of Unit Symbols and Unit Descriptions obtained from the Standard Unit & Unit Description tables.

 5. A new member selector dialog has been introduced into the Modeling area of SAC

 

A comprehensive list of SAC features for each QRC release can be found in our What's New - 2025 Releases Guide.

If you have any questions, feel free to comment below or post a question to our SAP Analytics Cloud Questions & Answers forum.

See this SAP Knowledge Base Article if you‚Äôd like to learn more about FastTrack and Quarterly Release Cycle releases.

For further information, visit our SAP Analytics Cloud Community pages to find more product information, best practices, and more. 

To find out more about QRC release dates, see SAP Analytics Cloud tenants on Quarterly Release Cycle (QRC) updates in 2025.

Check out our SAP Road Map Explorer to see more upcoming features of SAP Analytics Cloud.

Thanks for reading!

entry.title: Re: Mass uploading sales orders via DTW, how can I trigge...
entry.content:
@jpfp ,

We face a similar issue with another tax engine.

The API call is only triggered by the UI, hence, DTW or any other integrations that create documents in the system will not contain tax calculation. The users must hit "calculate tax" SO and watch the engine populate tax line by line.

I don't see an alternative apart from entering the tax from the document upload, as suggested already by @Johan_Hakkesteegt.

Finally, it might worth checking with the vendor if they have another way to fetch tax calculations. In our case, they do. Basically, the document posting action triggers the API call (regardless its source), and the response populates the payload on the fly, which will be committed as transaction. So, there is no need to rely on Add-Ons and UI tricks to make it happen.

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: Re: Add Field in SO Form Template datasource
entry.content:
Hello @KhaingZinTun 

Thank you for providing the screenshots. If a field appears in the Sales Order SO form XML but has no value, it is most likely due to an incorrect node or path in the data source, or because the output item was created before the extension's publication. Can you verify that the size and dimensions specified in the product used for the test order are maintained?

Extend the data source and node correctly, then publish. Use Custom Fields and Logic ‚Üí Data Source Extensions. For SO confirmation, the data source is FDP_V1_ORDER_CONFIRM_SRV. Add the field to the Item ‚Üí Product path and publish. SAP Help Portal-Data Source Extensions

Regenerate the output item after publishing.
Create a new output or resend the existing one, then download the resulting XML. Note that existing outputs do not populate any new fields that are added; this is a known behaviour of SAP. SAP Support Portal-3076122 - Newly-added field via Data Source Extension is empty in the output XML file of an existing Sales Order

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: New video tutorials to help our Suppliers master the network catalog
entry.content:
Great news! We've just released 5 new video tutorials to help you make the most of the network catalog in SAP Business Network. Whether you're just getting started or want to see it in action, these videos are here to guide and help you on your journey to easily achieve better efficiency and automation.

What‚Äôs Covered?

  • Step-by-Step Guidance: From the basics of uploading catalogs to responding to new opportunities, we've got you covered.
  • Added Value: Learn about the perks of using the Network Catalog, including features available with the Promote Package.
  • Easy Learning: Ideal for onboarding new team members, training, and encouraging the use of catalog capabilities.

Where to Find Them?

Access the  playlist in our community page SAP Business Network for Suppliers (Catalogs section).

These tutorials are designed to make your catalog management a breeze, so make the most of the SAP Business Network Network Catalog!

Feel free to share your experiences and feedback in our community forums. We‚Äôd love to hear how these tutorials and materials are helping your business.

entry.title: Re: configuration steps for the MM module.
entry.content:
SAP doesn‚Äôt publish a single ‚Äúone‚Äëstop‚Äù IMG‚Äëstyle configuration manual for MM, whether in ECC or S/4HANA Public Cloud. In the Public Cloud edition, configuration is done through SSCUIs (Self‚ÄëService Configuration UIs) and guided by SAP Best Practices rather than the traditional IMG.

That said, there are some excellent resources you can use to build your workshop material:

SAP Best Practices Explorer / Process Navigator Contains scope items (e.g., Procurement of Direct Materials, Operational Procurement) with test scripts, configuration guides, and process flows. Each scope item has accelerators (PDFs, configuration steps, diagrams) you can use directly in your workshop.

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Sourcing and Procurement Explains features, SSCUIs, and integration points with FI/CO/PS.

entry.title: Re: VAT registers - sequential page numbering / to fullfi...
entry.content:
For the VAT register report RFUMSV00 / S_ALR_87100833 page numbering issue, SAP has explicitly documented that the problem occurs when you run the report in foreground. The correction is to always execute it in background or with ‚ÄúExecute and Print.‚Äù

SAP Note 719631 explains that if you run the report in foreground (‚ÄúExecute‚Äù), the page counter can reset. The recommendation is to use ‚ÄúExecute and Print‚Äù or background execution to ensure correct sequential numbering.

SAP Note 1263757 provides corrections for sequential numbering across months, especially when saving page numbers in table RFUMSV00_BAL_IT.

entry.title: Re: S/4 Public cloud - Service - repair in house subcontr...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, in-house repair processes are managed with the In-House Repair (3XK) scope item, while subcontractor work is handled through Service Procurement. The workflow usually starts with creating a repair order when customer equipment is received. This allows you to document the condition, required actions, and plan the repair steps. If part of the job needs to be outsourced, you can create a purchase order for the subcontractor and track the service through a service entry sheet.

Logistics are supported by outbound and inbound deliveries, which give visibility over the movement of equipment when it‚Äôs sent to and received back from the subcontractor. This ensures that customer property is tracked at every stage.

The setup is practical because it separates internal tasks from external ones but still maintains overall traceability. Businesses outside of SAP follow similar models. For instance, service providers such as PS Home Maintenance often complete general repair tasks internally while relying on trusted subcontractors for specialized work. The key is having a system that balances accountability with flexibility, and SAP‚Äôs combination of repair orders, procurement, and delivery tracking makes this possible in the cloud environment.

entry.title: Re: SAPF110V and SAPMF05A Program last changed user is DDIC
entry.content:
Go to SE38 or SE80, enter the program name (e.g. SAPF110V). Use Utilities ‚Üí Versions ‚Üí Version Management. If there are no versions, it means the program was never modified in your system. Standard SAP programs do not have version history unless they were changed via modification.

Transaction SE95 (Modification Browser). Search for object type Program and enter SAPF110V or SAPMF05A. If nothing is listed, it confirms no modifications exist.

Transaction SE03 ‚Üí ‚ÄúDisplay Object Directory Entries‚Äù ‚Üí check if the program is marked as SAP standard (original system = SAP).

Check SAP Note 1291031: ‚ÄúNo changes for user DDIC allowed‚Äù ‚Äî this confirms SAP‚Äôs policy that DDIC cannot be used to modify repository objects in customer systems

entry.title: Re: Unknown number in RefKey 1 field in Accounting Doc
entry.content:
How the Sort Key works is in the G/L master record (FS00 ‚Üí Company Code Data ‚Üí Control Data tab), the field Sort Key determines what value is copied into the Assignment field (ZUONR) or Reference Key fields (XREF1/2/3) when a posting is made. Sort Key 21 (Segment text), for example, pulls data from the document segment text into the assignment/reference field. Other sort keys can pull things like PO number, cost center, or document number automatically

To trace the value, go to FS00 for the G/L account used in your posting. On the Control Data tab, note the Sort Key. Use transaction OB16 to see what field that sort key is configured to pull from (e.g., PO number, segment text, etc.).

Display your accounting document in FB03. Drill down into the line item where Reference Key 1 is filled. Compare the value with the source field defined in the sort key. For example, if Sort Key = 014 (Purchase Order), the system will copy the PO number from BSEG‚ÄëEBELN into the assignment/reference field.

entry.title: #13 - How to change the IT contact
entry.content:
Importance of the IT Contact

When an SAP Contract is signed, a Technical Administrator (also called the IT Contact) is nominated on the contract.

The IT Contact should be a hands-on system administrator with the skills to manage and troubleshoot the system, not an executive. This individual should be accessible, responsive to SAP communications, and actively engaged with the project and business stakeholders.

The IT Contact will:

  • Receive all technical communications about the startup of the SAP product (including provisioning emails & welcome email)
  • Become an S-user administrator.

More details about users and authorizations are available here.

If you noticed that the SAP IT Contact is incorrect, please change them ASAP to avoid complication and any delay of the project.

How to change IT Contact

There are two options for changing the IT Contact

  1. SAP Onboarding Token ‚Äì this is a self-service option available for 2 months from order booking. Recommended if contract has not already started.
  2. SAP Support Incident ‚Äì recommended if token has expired or contract has already started.

SAP Onboarding Token

The Onboarding Token is a digital code found on the sales order and is active as soon as the sales order is received. The Token can be used by anyone on the customer side but can only be used once and must be used within two months of creation.

The person who uses the token becomes the new IT contact for that order.

Using the token has two significant results:

  1. That person will receive all technical communications about the startup of that SAP product (including provisioning emails & welcome email);
  2. That person will become an S-user administrator.

Please note, the new Contact IT will only receive above communications if the token is redeemed prior to the contract start date.

SAP Support Incident

In case the Onboarding Token has expired or has already been redeemed, you can still change the IT Contact by creating a Support Incident via SAP for Me.

Recommendation: create the incident with the subject: ‚ÄúRequest to Change the IT Contact Person‚Äù. In the text description, please include:

  • The name and email address of the current and desired IT Contact
  • The Reason for the change
  • If applicable, request to resend the provisioning emails to the new IT Contact

Find more details on the SAP KBA 1296527: How to create a support case.

In Conclusion

The IT contact plays a crucial role in provisioning your SAP systems effectively. It is essential to ensure that the right person within your organization is designated for this role to facilitate seamless operations and communications. If a change in IT contact is necessary, this blog has outlined a straightforward procedure to make the transition quickly and efficiently.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Check out other blogs from the series   Customer Onboarding at SAP
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About the authors:

  • Keith is a system access topic expert in the SAP customer onboarding team and is passionate about customers first successful login to SAP products and support systems.
  • Linh Hoang is a strategy and program manager for the customer onboarding at SAP, overlooking the onboarding journey cross-solution areas.

Having questions, comments or feedbacks? Don't hesitate to comment down below or contact @KeithB  or @Linh-Hoang.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: GRC, Trade and Tax with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
With this blog I will walk you through the selected key highlights for Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC), Trade and Tax in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508:

In case you do not need all the information and just briefly want to get an overview of the release highlights, please watch the video below:

 
Video #1: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 GRC

This blog covers the following innovations:

SAP Risk and Assurance Management

  • Preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions (SAP Risk and Assurance Management)
  • Overview pages for controls
  • Overview pages for risks

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

  • Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling
  • Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network
  • India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B
  • Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

SAP International Trade Management

  • Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)
  • Localization option for Intrastat (BDT)
  • New compliance status for purchase orders
  • Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes
  • Audit trail for Watch List Screening

SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions (SAP Risk and Assurance Management)

Fig #1 : preconfigured business content to detect fraud and money laundering transactions

SAP Risk and Assurance Management comes with predefined business content that you can use of the box, such as predefined automated procedures and controls, to minimize the effort of building your financial compliance management framework.

Value Proposition

  • Speed up usage with predefined business content for detection rules
  • Enable finance departments to detect fraud or suspicious payments

Capabilities

  • New automated procedures with a focus on anti-money laundering and fraud:
    • High-risk country incoming payments
      • Check incoming payments against list of countries or regions deemed to be high-risk
    • Payer name deviation in incoming payments
      • Check incoming payments against transferring vendor name.
    • Postings on expense accounts
    • Outgoing payments on expense accounts
    • IBAN deviations in incoming payments
    • Customer negative amount postings by user
    • Customer negative amount postings by ratio

For more information, see: Business Content for SAP Risk and Assurance Management

Overview pages for controls

 

Video #2: Demo Overview Page

This Overview page is designed to help our Compliance Managers save time by effectively monitoring progress & getting an instant overview that no critical control runs are missed and helping him quickly identifying and analyzing errors in work packages.

Value Proposition

  • Centralised information hub
  • Improved decision making through real time monitoring
  • Profit from early awareness and proactive operations

Capabilities

  • Operational dashboard for the compliance manager to get an overview of controls and work packages of the organisation
  • Overview on control performance results in time intervals, by control risk level and significance and  work packages by procedure run status
  • Ability to navigate to the specific risk from the overview page

For more information, see: Controls Analytics

Overview pages for risk management

Fig #2 : overview pages for risk management

A risk heat map is an important tool for a risk manager helping them identify, prioritize, and address risks, as well as communicate about risks with stakeholders.

Value Proposition

  • Gain real-time risk visibility
  • Improve the efficiency of the risk manager
  • Profit from early awareness and proactive risk management

Capabilities

  • Visualised dashboard that helps risk managers gain insights into the overall risk status of the organization
  • Heatmaps showing the current risk landscape
  • View risks by different dimensions, such as organization unit, risk category, and so on
  • Ability to navigate to the specific risk from the overview page

For more information, see: Risk Overview

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling

 

Video #3:  Statutory reporting: mass action and scheduling

Schedule Mass Action enables you to automate the generation of multiple report runs simultaneously and set them to recur at desired intervals. This feature is beneficial for streamlining reporting processes, saving time, and ensuring consistency in report generation.

Mass Action now also supports trigger of workflow approvals and submission of report runs electronically.

The Update Reporting Tasks feature allows you to instantly update specific reporting tasks for a desired reporting year through the reports dashboard.

A new submission status has now been introduced for the processing of runs with large volumes of documents. When a run involves more than 100 documents, the status will now display as Submission In Progress.

Benefits

  • Automate the approval and submission process, improving overall efficiency
  • Automate and schedule report generation, helping ensure consistency, improving efficiency, and reducing errors
  • Provide flexible options for defining report generation schedules
  • Improve efficiency and consistency in statutory reporting by streamlining the application of common properties across multiple reports
  • Introduce a separate option to create or update reporting tasks, providing users with the flexibility to create or update reporting tasks as and when desired, rather than wait for the technical job to run

For more information please refer to :

  • Help Document: Trigger Mass Action
  • Define Statutory Reports
  • Help Document: Electronic Submission of Reports
  • Help Document: Mass Action
  • Help Document: Schedule Mass Action
  • Help Document: Update Reporting Tasks
  • Run Statutory Reports

Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network

Fig #3: Malaysia e-invoicing: exchange of electronic invoices through the Peppol network Malaysia e-invoicing regulation:

  • When you sell goods or services to a customer, you should create and submit an electronic invoice to the Inland Revenue Board of Malaysia (IRBM) first for clearance. Once the IRBM clears the electronic invoice, you can then send it to the customer.
  • Once the electronic invoice is cleared, you can then send it to your business partner over the Peppol network with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.
  • As of May 28, 2025, official accreditation of SAP as a service provider and Peppol-ready solution provider by the Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC).

Exchanging electronic documents (invoices, credit notes, debit notes) through the Peppol network is enabled.

More details: Sending Electronic Invoices to Customers Using Peppol

India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B

Fig #4: India Goods and services tax (GST) reporting - GSTR-1, GSTR-2A and GSTR-3B

  • Monthly outward supplies return (GSTR-1):
    • Automated retrieval of auto-populated GSTR-1 from the goods and service tax network (GSTN) (in a draft return) and comparison against business transactions in the sales register in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • Review and finalization of the draft return, including the digital signature and filing
  • Inward purchase invoices and reconciliation:
    • Automatically retrieve GSTR-2A invoices from the GSTN portal and reconcile them against business transactions in the purchase register in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Monthly consolidated tax return (GSTR-3B):
    • Automated retrieval of data from GSTN (manual input of 2B data), review, and manual adjustment with traceability and filing

More details: India GSTR reports

Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

Fig #5: Accelerated electronic document corrections with GenAI

As countries rapidly adopt e-invoicing mandates, tax accountants face growing challenges in handling complex, technical errors from high-volume electronic document exchanges. Joule with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance enables tax accountants to quickly understand these errors via clear explanations in natural language, without digging into complex formats and technical descriptions. This results in faster processing, reduced penalties, and improved cash flow‚Äîsaving both time and money.‚Äã

Value Proposition‚Äã

  • Easy to understand explanations to complex electronic document errors.‚Äã
  • Uncover error root causes faster with resolution recommendations.‚Äã
  • Boost productivity and drive better business results.‚Äã
  • Better user experience with native language support.‚Äã

Capabilities‚Äã

  • User can simply ask Joule for error explanation in natural language.‚Äã
  • Get easy to understand context aware explanations.‚Äã
  • Error explanation include root cause and recommended resolution steps‚Äã
  • User can explore details via relevant SAP Help Documentation links provided.‚Äã
  • User can leverage multi-language capabilities for better experience. ‚Äã

For more information, see: Help Document: Electronic Document Error Handling with SAP Joule

SAP International Trade Management

Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)

Fig #6: Cloud BAdIs for Intrastat (BDT)

Three cloud BAdIs are provided to select additional documents and change detail data. 

  • INTRASTAT_GET_BILLING_DOCS: to select additional billing documents not selected by standard selection report
  • INTRASTAT_GET_PURCHASE_DOCS: to select additional purchase documents not selected by standard selection report
  • INTRASTAT_CHANGE_DATA: to change data in documents selected by selection reports (which are selected via both standard and BAdIs)

For more information, please check New BAdI for Intrastat: Get Additional Purchasing Documents

Localization option for Intrastat (BDT) Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Malta

Fig #7: Localization option for Intrastat (BDT) Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Cyprus, Malta

Customers that want to implement Intrastat for non-standard countries, must use the SAP Central Business Configuration tool to access the new configuration items.

Configuration item 1: Basic data for Intrastat

Configuration item 2: Default values for Intrastat

Configuration item 3: Data selection for Intrastat

For more information, please see New Configuration Items for Intrastat Non-Standard Countries

New compliance status for purchase orders

Fig #8: New compliance status for purchase orders

With this feature, a Trade Compliance specialist can check on dedicated international trade compliance statuses for embargo, legal control, and screening in purchase orders.

Value Proposition

  • Gain transparency on dedicated statuses of international trade compliance checks in purchase orders
  • Help ensure frictionless international trade processes

Capabilities 

  • Dedicated international trade compliance statuses for embargo, legal control, and screening in purchase orders
  • New status fields to be available on purchase order header and item level in the purchase order advanced app
  • New status fields substitute the compliance status by the on-hold status in the purchase order

For more information, see Dedicated Trade Compliance Statuses in Purchase Orders‚Äã and Product Compliance in Purchase Orders

Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes

 

Video #4: Trade classification proposals for custom tariff numbers and commodity codes

Increase productivity and leverage already existing trade product classifications for your decisions with AI-assisted trade classification proposals with fuzzy search

  • Step 1: Enable generation classification proposals for each numbering scheme
  • Step 2: Schedule jobs for classification proposals
  • Step 3: Optimize generated trade classification proposals (optional)

For more information, see:  Product Classification Proposal

Audit trail for Watch List Screening

 

Video #5: Audit trail for Watch List Screening

With this app you can display an audit trail for your screening requests. The app shows an overview of all screening requests. You can navigate to single screening requests for more information.

Value Proposition

  • Support audits by providing data

Capabilities 

  • The app shows an overview of all screening requests. You can navigate to single screening requests for more information.

For more information, see: Display Audit Trail

Hi Eric, please help me understand the question better:

You asked: "I would like to know what is the relevant customizing to have the correct Storage Location when I create the Inbound Delivery.".

So your question is how to determine the correct storage location? But you already wrote above: "In the Purchase Order, the requested Storage Location is indicated."

Is your question perhaps, how to determine the goods receipt area (= the storage bin) based on the storage location?

Thanks,
Christian
